Title: Sumika's Notes - Entry 136
Text:
Day 136 – Abnormal Pressure (If this constant pressure in my ears counts as such)

Among the supplies Chisa brought back today was a can of oranges, the label printed with a production date long past... but that hardly matters anymore. These so-called "foods" are really just compressed Remnant Energy.

Chisa gave the can to me. She sat off to the side with a piece of spring steel she'd salvaged, slicing it into a curved blade using her Forte, turning it into a new weapon. Watching her, I suddenly recalled another day. She was sitting just like this, halfway through organizing supplies on the sofa, when she turned and asked me what my Forte really was. I showed her a small amber, the one containing a preserved memory of the first time we worked together at this home base: the lights were dim, she was repairing a weapon, and I was taking notes on anomalies in the city's time flow. It was a rare, peaceful night, as long as we could ignore the fact that we were still trapped in a city sealed off from the outside world.

To hold out against the erratic occurrences of the Lament, I once tried to learn Chisa's practical skills, but I failed. Of course I did. Still, she taught me a few special ways to leave markings. I remember what she said back then: "Stop treating everything like a science experiment. Think of every piece of scrap metal as a blade that never misses—"

(The pen pierced the page, leaving a blot of ink.)

And I know she truly meant it.

This city, drenched in Lament, is riddled with danger. And yet, she always throws herself forward to shield everyone else. She thinks I haven't noticed how much she's burning herself out... doesn't know her body's running at the edge of collapse. But I've done the calculations many times. I know exactly how long she has before she crosses the breaking point. The only good thing is that this Sonoro seems to have stalled time and her condition. But I can't let her stay like this forever. I want to take her back. Back to the Black Shores, to the people I trust. There has to be a solution waiting there.

I'll bring her back. No matter the cost.
